title: Portsmouth vs Arsenal LIVE : FA Cup latest score and confirmed lineups
body_text:
Gabriel Martinelli’s hat-trick fired Arsenal to a 4-1 win over Portsmouth in the FA Cup third round, but it was an otherwise nervy performance from the Premier League leaders.
After Macclesfield’s major upset win over holders Crystal Palace, another giant-killing was on the cards as Championship strugglers Pompey took the lead inside three minutes at Fratton Park.
The heavily-rotated Gunners quickly equalised however and made the most of their set-piece prowess to get the job done – even with Noni Madueke blazing a penalty wide.
Portsmouth flew out of the traps with their high-press catching Mikel Arteta’s men out and the ground was rocking when Colby Bishop lashed in the opener from close range after Kepa Arrizabalaga parried a shot into his path.
Arsenal responded quickly and were level just five minutes later as the home side failed to clear a corner, with the ball deflecting across the line off the unfortunate Andre Dozzell.
But Pompey were not deterred and gave the Premier League title favourites a run for the money, with the likes of Eberechi Eze, Mikel Merino and Myles Lewis-Skelly struggling to get a foothold in the game.
But they simply could not deal with Arsenal’s pristine corners, with Martinelli heading the visitors ahead with relative ease.
Get your football fix
Don't want to miss the week's biggest football stories? Metro's exclusive football newsletter, In The Mixer, is your essential guide.
From the latest transfer rumours and managerial moves to analysis of the biggest games and a lot more, our experts have you covered.
Sign up here, it's an open goal.
They should have been 3-1 up at the break after Madueke was fouled in the box but while the England winger’s slow, stuttered run up sent the keeper the wrong way, he fired his penalty wide of the post – much to the amusement of Fratton Park faithful.
More Trending
Martinelli did make it 3-1 just after the break, tapping home at the far post from Gabriel Jesus’ perfect low cross, before he completed his first career hat-trick with a carbon copy of his first goal.
Pompey can take pride from their performance and now focus on avoiding relegation to League One, with John Mousinho’s side one point above the drop zone.
Arsenal will be in the fourth round draw on Monday night but attention now turns to their Carabao Cup semi-final first-leg against Chelsea.
Relive all the action with Metro’s LIVE matchday blog
Live Feed
This Live Blog has now ended
This blog is now closed. For the latest updates, visit Metro’s Football page.
Follow Man Utd vs Brighton
That brings to an end our coverage of Portsmouth vs Arsenal but the FA Cup action isn’t over.
Manchester United take on Brighton in a few minutes and you can follow that game right here.
Proud Pompey
Portsmouth should be very proud of themselves, that scoreline does not reflect their performance.
John Mousinho has bigger fish to fry though – staying in the Championship is the priority.
Full-time! Portsmouth 1-4 Arsenal
Havertz sees a shot blocked in the last seconds and the referee blows for full-time.
A great scoreline if not a great performance from Arsenal but they have made it through to the fourth round of the FA Cup.
90 mins: Portsmouth 1-4 Arsenal
Zubimendi thumps one from range but it sails wide.
Three minutes added on.
86 mins: Portsmouth 1-4 Arsenal
Ouch. Eze goes to volley in a deflected ball at the far post but catches Devlin as he bravely blocked the shot for a corner.
The Pompey man is in a bit of pain but will continue
83 mins: Portsmouth 1-4 Arsenal
He’s been pretty quiet today but Eze has nearly made it five.
A powerful effort from range is well saved.
Hat-trick hero Martinelli’s afternoon is done. Zubimendi takes his place.
76 mins: Portsmouth 1-4 Arsenal
A special moment here as 16-year-old Marli Salmon replaces Gabriel.
He becomes the youngest player to represent Arsenal in the FA Cup.
75 mins: Portsmouth 1-4 Arsenal
The Gunners have scored three times from four corners.
Set Piece F.C. strikes again.
And they’ve just won another one… this one doesn’t find the back of the net.
GOAL! Portsmouth 1-4 Arsenal (Martinelli)
Hat-trick!
Madueke wins a corner and it’s a carbon copy of the second goal – Madueke sends it in and Martinelli heads it into the back of the net.
A hat-trick of corners for Arsenal and Martinelli has his first hat-trick in senior football.
70 mins: Portsmouth 1-3 Arsenal
White goes in the book for a poor foul
Thats the right-back’s last involvement as Arteta makes his first changes: Jesus, Nwaneri and White are off. Havertz, Odegaard and Timber are on
64 mins: Portsmouth 1-3 Arsenal
Portsmouth are still playing well but need a magic spark to get back into this game.
Mousinho makes two changes on the hour mark: Pack and Ogilvie replace Le Roux and Shaughnessy
60 mins: Portsmouth 1-3 Arsenal
Really good football from the Gunners as White and Nwaneri combine on the right. It’s passed to Madueke who does well after being swamped by defenders but the keeper gathers the ball.
Moments later, there’s some words between Gabriel and the home fans after one of them touches his back as he goes to take a throw in.
The defender is now being jeered with every touch.
57 mins: Portsmouth 1-3 Arsenal
Le Roux gets Pompey’s first yellow for scything down Nwaneri.
Devlin is then penalised for holding onto Martinelli. The home fans aren’t happy with that and they may have a point. Didn’t appear to be a foul
54 mins: Portsmouth 1-3 Arsenal
Pompey aren’t giving in and win a succession of corners.
Kepa flaps at the second one but Arsenal get away with it.
GOAL! Portsmouth 1-3 Arsenal (Martinelli)
Against the run of play!
For the first time since the break, Arsenal get forward and Jesus puts in a fantastic low cross for Martinelli to tap in at the far post.
He missed from a similar angle in the first-half but makes no mistake this time.
The Gunners have breathing space but this game isn’t done just yet…
50 mins: Portsmouth 1-2 Arsenal
Once again, Portsmouth have started with great energy.
They win a corner and Arsenal can’t deal with it. The ball falls to Chaplin at the far post who lashes a shot on the half volley… but Jesus is there to block the shot!
Second-half kick-off!
Despite finding the back of the net twice and having a penalty, Arsenal managed just ONE shot on target in that first-half.
We’re back underway at Fratton Park. No changes for either side.
Around the grounds
Away from Fratton Park, Leeds beat rivals Derby 3-1 in today’s early kick-off.
Five other games are currently in progress, with Premier League strugglers West Ham being held 0-0 by QPR.
Norwich are 2-0 up against Walsall, while Sheffield United are drawing 1-1 with Mansfield Town.
Hull vs Blackburn Rovers and Swansea vs West Brom are goalless.
Half-time! Portsmouth 1-2 Arsenal
And breathe…
The ref calls time on a thrilling first-half that has had a bit of everything. A proper cup tie this.
Arsenal have the lead but I can’t imagine Mikel Arteta will be happy with what he’s seen. Pompey boss John Mousinho will be full of optimism in hi half-time team talk
45 mins: Portsmouth 1-2 Arsenal
It’s all happening now!
Lewis-Skelly is the first player in the book after bring down a Pompey attacker and gives away a free-kick in a good position.
The home side don’t make the most of it however.
Three minutes added on the first half.
MORE: Man Utd 1-2 Brighton: Danny Welbeck strike dumps Red Devils out of the FA Cup
